column4: This looks like a cool thing to share. #PSTweetChat RT @thetommymaynard: This is still one of my favorite things that @Lee_Holmes has shared: $PSDefaultParameterValues["Out-Default:OutVariable"] = "__". The output of every command ends up in $__. FYI: That is two underscores. Put it in your $PROFILE. #PowerShell

column4: Convert to Local Time with PowerShell As some of you know, I host a monthly online Twitter chat on the first Friday of every month using the #PSTweetChat tag (although the January 2021 chat will be on 8 January.) We get together and chat about all things PowerShell at 1:00PM…

At work I have taken to doing “lightning talks” to improve my teammates PowerShell. Rather than calling a meeting, I do a solo zoom, record and share. Shooting for a single topic and under 15 minutes; preferably 10. Today was using [io.fileinfo] effectively. #pstweetchat

column4: @FrankLesniak #PSTweetChat use measure-object and test it yourself! Try a smaller sample size then ramp up, and eliminate ones that clearly don't perform well for your data and keep ramping it up :)

#PowerShell people: has anyone performance tested the different Join-Object implementations from ili101, iRon7, and RamblingCookieMonster? I'm working with a very large data set and being impatient -- which is the fastest for a full join of two *huge* CSVs? #PSTweetChat

column4: @JeffHicks Using Set-Clipboard PS H:\> $data = @("item1","item2") PS H:\> $data | Set-Clipboard PS H:\> $clipboard = Get-Clipboard PS H:\> $clipboard item1 item2 PS H:\> #PSTweetChat
column18: Husband-Father, Persistent Learner, PowerShell Junkie, Co-Organizer RTPSUG, Citrix Engineer, EUC Opinions are my own

column4: @Schlauge Even better use the scb alias for Set-Clipboard #PSTweetChat
column18: IT Pro veteran, Microsoft MVP, author, teacher, speaker, Pluralsight author. AKA Prof. PowerShell Emeritus.

column4: @JeffHicks PS H:\> $data = @("item1","item2") PS H:\> $data | clip PS H:\> $clip = Get-Clipboard PS H:\> $clip item1 item2 PS H:\> $newclip = (Get-Clipboard) -notlike "" PS H:\> $newclip item1 item2 PS H:\> #PSTweetChat
